article: There was a man who had a little boy that he loved very much. Every day after work the man would come home and _ with the little boy. He would always _ all of his extern) time with the little boy. One night. while the man was at work, he _ that he had extra work to do for the evening, and that he wouldn't be able to play with his little boy. _ he wanted to be able to give the boy something to keep him _ . So, looking around his office, he saw a magazine with a large _ of the world on the cover. He got a(n) _ . He removed the map, and then patiently tore it up into small pieces. Then he put all the _ in his coat pocket. When he got home, the little boy came _ to him and was ready to play. The man _ that he had extra work to do and couldn't play just now. He _ the little boy into the dinning room, and took out all the pieces of the map. He spread them on the table. He explained that it was a map of the world, and that by the time he could put it back together, his extra work would be _ , and they could both play. Surely this would keep the child busy for hours, he thought. About half an hour later the boy came to the man and said, "Okay, it's finished. Can we play now?" The man was _ , saying, "That's impossible. Let's have a look." And _ enough, there was the picture of the world, all put together, every piece in its _ . The man said, "That's amazing! How did you do that?" The boy said, "It's _ . On the _ of the page is a(n) _ of a man. When I put the man together the whole world fell into place."
